IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: St. Joseph's Center (the "Center") is a not-for-profit corporation founded by the Congregation of Sisters, Servants of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, Scranton, Pennsylvania. The Center is located in Lackawanna County, PA and provides services primarily to residents of Lackawanna and Luzerne counties. Its general purpose is to provide rehabilitation and developmental services in various institutional and community-based settings to individuals who are physically and emotionally impaired-to foster the welfare of the individuals and their families in any appropriate manner. The Center also operates group homes in Lackawanna and Luzerne Counties and provides a variety of services to unwed mothers and persons seeking to adopt.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Center has 3 endowments. One to be used for the needs of the children, the second is to be used for the construction and maintenance of the Weinberg Pool Therapy Building and the third is to be used to benefit St. Joseph's Center.

The Center is a Not-forprofit corporation as described in sction 501( c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and is exempt from federa income taxes on its exempt income under section 501 (a) of the code. The Center accounts for uncertainty in income taxe using a recognitin threshold of more-likely-than-not to be sustained upon examination by th eappropriate taxing authority. measurement of the tax uncertainty occurs if the rethe recognition thrreshold is met. Management determined there were no tax uncertainties that met the recognition threshold in 2010. The center's federal exempt organization business income tax returns for 2009, 2008 and 2007 remain subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service.
Change in interest in net assets of affiliates.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: To fund the Center's 2004 Capital Improvement Projects

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is prepared by the Accounting Manager and is reviewed by the Vice-President for Finance/CFO before it is submitted to the IRS

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: To determine the appropriateness of the salary to be paid to the CFO, the board reviewed a compensation study from the Pennsylvania Association of Resources, Autism and intellectual Disabilities (PAR).

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: St. Joseph's Center makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
